result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Dane County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Each ct concur & concur to 14CF1785. W/H adjudication on ct 1. If at the end of probation there have been no new charges arising to probable cause and if the def has successfully completed probation, meaning that all of the conditions have been met, restitution is pd and there have been no ATR's, then the State would have no objection to dismissing ct 1.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order. Def is to make pmts on the restitution of $500 per month.  To be collected by the Department of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
$200 DNA surcharge remitted. $253  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.
Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment.
Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with TV or any former employee of the former Ultimate Spa. Not to handle any financial documents not in his name.

Def is to make all of the contracted pmts for the property on Monona Dr pursuant to the land contract until and unless there is a foreclosure. Def is to have legal counsel and a realtor handle any real estate transavtion or property transaction. File tax returns on his personal accts and his business acct each yr with a copy to agent and any refunds to restitution. Def is to follow the court orders relative to foreclosure.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: 12/1/15 Court orders 20 days jail time as a condition of probation to be served starting 12/2/15 at 7am, can be served with huber but not on the bracelet

miscConds.notes: $243  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.
All other conditions are the same as count 2 (except jail time).

To the extent the order appealed from in #2021AP66 is nonfinal, we grant leave to appeal under Wis. Stat. 808.03(2) and appellate jurisdiction is confirmed over both appeals.  These cases have been consolidated by the Court.  #2021AP67 is an appeal to be decided by one judge the appellant was convicted of only misdemeanor crimines.

Motion to Court of Appeals to Extend Time for the Circuit Court to Issue a Decision on Defendant-Appellant's Postconviction Motion; Defn

Hearing held by Zoom and live on YouTube.  Cases 14cf305 and 14CF1785 addressed together. Attorney Paul W. Humphrey appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Adam Matthias Welch appeared by video means for Defendant Peter J Cloonan. Defendant Peter J Cloonan appeared by video means.  Court speaks to motion, talks to hearing on 8/31, speaks to pending warrant out on case.  Will not address this at this time, Court will take motion to withdraw plea, and will issue a written ruling on the outstanding warrant and court jurisdiction.  Atty. Welch speaks to documents 58 and 59, these are CCAP screens, asking court to take judicial notice.  ADA Humphrey does not object.  Court takes judicial notice of those documents.   Atty. Welch calls Peter Cloonan, sworn.  Direct.  Cross by ADA Humphrey. Re-direct by Atty. Welch.  Atty. Welch has no more witnesses.  Atty. Welch states he doesn't need to call previous attorney.  ADA Humphrey calls Steve Cohen, sworn.  Direct.  Cross by Atty. Welch.  Witness excused at 12:19.  No other witnesses by State.  Court asks Atty. Welch for final argument.  Atty. Welch argues.  ADA Humphrey argues.  Rebuttal by Atty. Welch.  Court takes this motion under advisement.  Giving parties time to submit additional case law, not asking for briefs.  Deadline of 10 days, December 14, 2020 due to weekend.  Court will issue a written decision as soon as she can.  Court instructs Atty. Welch to motion for time on extension.  Court adjourned.

Defendant, Attorney Adam Welch and Attorney Stephen Cohen appear.   Paul W. Humphrey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  This is a ZOOM hearing and it is also live on YouTube.  We are here on a Motion to Withdraw Plea.  Court would like to deal with the outstanding warrants prior to hearing the motion.  Atty Welch feels it is okay to deal with the motion with the warrants in place.  ADA Humphrey feels the Ct lacks personal jurisdiction while the warrants are still in place.  Ct decides to give the parties a chance to research this fact and sets a briefing schedule.  ADA Humphrey to file the first brief by Sept 30.  Atty Welch to file reply by October 14.  This would also give the defendant a chance to turn himself in and remove the obsconder status.
